headline.main: THE GREAT EXHIBITION.; GRAND COMPLIMENTARY DINNER. Speech of the President of the United States. Remarks of Mr. Guthrie, Gen. Davis and Gen. Cushing. Toasts, Music, Misccllancous Speeches, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Directors of the Exhibition of the Industry of All Nations gave a magnificent complimentary banquet last night, at the Metropolitan Hotel, to the President of the United States and the Commissioners from foreign nations, in attendance upon the Exhibition. The dinner was laid in the large dining-hall of the Metropolitan, which was very handsomely and appropriately fitted up for the occasion.

docs.lead_paragraph: During the voyage of the brig Eastern State, Capt. Nathaniel Gamage, of Bristol, Me., from Darien, Ga., (which arrived at Boston on Friday night, with a cargo of lumber,) the captain, mate, and crew of six men, by turns, all fell sick of fever and ague, so that at times there were scarcely enough well men to manage the vessel.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: Everything concerning the old Continental Congress possesses great interest, and cannot be too often contemplated by Americans. Allow me to append to the communications of B. W. G. and his censor, a few facts in relation to the first Chaplain of Congress, which they have omitted.
